variant.question:
If an EU operator is arranging for a dry lease-in from a non-EU operator, which two of the following must they prove to the national authority: 
1.    An operational need has been identified that cannot be satisfied through leasing an aircraft registered in the EU
2.    That the lease-in will not last for any longer than 7 months in a consecutive 12 month period 
3.    That the third party operator holds a valid AOC 
4.    The safety standards of the third country operator with regard to continuing airworthiness and air operations are equivalent to EASA regulations
According to AIR OPS, which of the following is the correct definition of "dry lease"?

options.text: The aircraft is operated under the AOC of the person to whom it is leased.
The leased aircraft comes complete with flight crew.
The aircraft is operated under the AOC of the person from who it is leased.
The person leasing the aircraft is responsible for fuel etc.

variant.question: What does EASA AIR OPS apply to?

options.text: Commercial air transport operations with aeroplanes and helicopters.
Aeroplanes and helicopters used by police and customs departments.
Aeroplanes and helicopters used by defence departments.
Aeroplanes and helicopters proceeding from European states or flying over them.

variant.question: An Air Operator Certificate is applicable to:

options.text: an operator who is conducting commercial air operations.
an operator who is conducting operations for hire and reward.
an operator who is conducting aerial work.

variant.question:
For the continued validity of an AOC, the operator should comply with the following conditions:1. All aircraft operated have a certificate of airworthiness (CofA) in accordance with Regulations 
 2. The operatorâ€™s organisation and management are suitable and properly matched to the scale and scope of the operation. 
 3. The operator shall provide the required information concerning the intended operation to the competent authority 
 4. The operator should remain in compliance with the relevant requirements of Regulations. 
 5. The competent authority being granted access to the operator to determine continued compliance with the relevant requirements of Regulations 
 6. The certificate remains valid and is not surrendered or revoked

The regulatory authority issuing an Air Operators Certificate must be permitted access to aircraft covered by that AOC. Which of the following statements is true regarding the rights of access of an inspector?

options.text:
A captain may refuse an inspector access to the flight
deck in flight, but only on the basis of safety.

An inspector is permitted to be on board an aircraft but
only on the ground.

An inspector is permitted to be on board an aircraft at
any time during ground or flight, including flight deck access
under all circumstances.

An operator may refuse an inspector access to the flight
deck in flight.

variant.question: What are the regulatory conditions to be met for issue and continued validity of an AOC?

options.text: The operator remaining in compliance of all regulations and granting full access to the competent Authority.
The original certificate must be surrendered and re-issued followed an inspection by the Authority.
The original certificate must be surrendered and re-issued within 28 days following an inspection by the Authority.
Any findings for non-compliance will revoke the AOC.

variant.question: An AOC holder should demonstrate to the competent authority a management system which should include: i. clearly defined lines of responsibility and accountability; ii. a description of the flight safety philosophies and principles; iii. the identification of aviation safety hazards entailed by the activities of the operator; iv. maintaining personnel trained and competent to perform their tasks; v. documentation of all management system key processes; vi. a function to monitor compliance of the operator with the relevant requirements.

options.text: i, ii, iii, iv, v vi

variant.question:
Conditions to be met for the issue and continued validity of an AOC. The operator shall provide the following information to the competent authority:
1. the official name and business name, address, and mailing address of the applicant.
2. the name of the accountable manager.
3. the total number of employees.
4. the type(s), and number of aircraft to be operated.
5. the common language spoken by the crew members.
The combination of all correct statements is:
What defines the size and type of Safety Management System for an AOC holder operating under EU Regulation 965/2012.

options.text: The management system shall correspond to the size of the operator and the nature and complexity of its activities, taking into account the hazards and associated risks inherent in these activities.
The management system shall correspond to the number of aircraft registered by the AOC holder with the Authority.

A defined and established management system is mandatory for all operations approved under the AOC taking into account the areas of operations and hazards and associated risks inherent in these activities with complex motor powered aircraft.
The management system shall correspond to the size of the operator, the route structure and specific approval operations.

variant.question:
An EU operator is applying to a competent authority for an approval to dry lease-in an aircraft that is registered in a third country. Which of the items below is the EU operator required to demonstrate to the competent authority?
1. An operational need has been identified that cannot be satisfied through leasing an EU-registered aircraft.
2. The duration of the dry lease-in does not exceed 7 months in any 12 consecutive month period.
3. The aircraft has a Certificate of Airworthiness issued in accordance with ICAO Annex 6
According to AIR OPS, what is the definition of an Air Operator Certificate?

options.text: A certificate authorising an operator to carry out specified commercial air transport operations.
A certificate needed to carry out specified commercial international air transport operations, but not for domestic commercial flights.
A certificate automatically authorising an operator to carry out domestic air services in any ICAO contracting State.
A certificate the crew will present to immigration officers, stating that all passengers on board fulfil the visa requirements needed.

variant.question: For what purpose is an Air Operator Certificate (AOC) required?

options.text: Operating a helicopter for commercial air transport
Operating a helicopter for all activities involving hire and reward
Operating a helicopter for aerial work
Operating a helicopter for commercial air transport and aerial work

variant.question:
Which of the following conditions should the operator comply with for the continued validity of an AOC?
i.    all aircraft operated have a certificate of airworthiness (CofA) in accordance with Regulations
ii.    the operatorâ€™s organisation and management are suitable and properly matched to the scale and scope of the operation.
iii.    the operator shall provide the required information concerning the intended operation to the competent authority
iv.    the operator should remaining in compliance with the relevant requirements of Regulations.
v.    the competent authority being granted access to the operator to determine continued compliance with the relevant requirements of Regulations
vi.    the certificate remains valid and is not surrendered or revoked
Under which certificate can an aircraft be operated on for an aircraft under a dry lease?
An Air Operator Certificate is issued by:
An Air Operators Certificate is issued by:

options.text: The National Authority of the state in which the operator is registered

variant.question: A pilot flies for an AOC holder. Where will he find information on the AOC holders authorised areas of operation, aerodromes and route structure?
A pilot flies for an AOC holder operating complex motor-powered aircraft. In which document will he / she find type-related instructions and procedures for the aircraft flown?
A pilot flies for an AOC holder operating complex motor-powered aircraft. In which document will he/she find type-related instructions and procedures for the aircraft flown?

A pilot flies for an AOC holder operating complex motor-powered aircraft
In which document will he/she find type-related instructions and procedures for the aircraft flown?
Organisation requirements to be followed by an air operator conducting Commercial Air Transport operations are contained in..

Refer to figure. 
 An aircraft Operator within the EU wishes to apply for an AOC. Which of the following most accurately identifies the â€œIssuing Authority"?

options.text: It is EASA or the relevant Member State Competent Authority.
It is the International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO).
It is the Competent Authority/ies of the Member States where the Operator flies.
It is the aircraft Operator applying for the AOC.

variant.question:
An aircraft is operating a commercial flight from Italy to Libya. Whose rules of the air should be followed?
1. Italy 
 2. Libya 
 3. ICAO rules of the air 
 4. The state being overflown

An airline operator has just made significant changes to the 'continuing airworthiness' part of its management system because it is opening up a maintenance facility at a new location. Before implementing these changes, the operator shall seek approval from:
OPS regulation requires that a co-pilot is not assigned to operate an aeroplane as part of the minimum certificated crew, unless

options.text: he has carried out three take-offs and three landings in the previous 90 days, as pilot flying in an aeroplane, or in a flight simulator, of the same type/class.
he has operated the controls as a pilot for three take-offs and landings in an aeroplane in the previous 90 days.
he has operated the controls as a pilot for three take-offs and landings in an aeroplane in the previous 60 days.
he has operated the controls as a pilot for three take-offs and landings in the previous 60 days, in an aeroplane of the same type/class or in a flight simulator of the aeroplane type to be used.
